title: XSS on redirection page( Bypassed)
vulnerability_information:
Hello Semrush Team, 
 In this report id ```311330```, I was filled duplicate and redirection url is fixed which  made me feel happy as deserving bounty hunter gets a reward.

However, after fixing from last night, I finally bypassed the redirection method which not only Triggered Xss, but also it redirects to somewhere else.

```
https://www.semrush.com/redirect?url=https://(websitelink)
```

#To reproduce

So,I tried to craft a XSS like ```javascript://%0aalert(document.cookie)``` at the end of redirection Url,so it doesn't work.
Afterwards,I encoded %0a to %250a, then modified the payload and injected at the end of url and it works like a charm.

Here are the XSS payloads
https://www.semrush.com/redirect?url=javascript://%250Aalert(document.cookie)
https://www.semrush.com/redirect?url=javascript://%250Aalert(document.domain)

When a particular user clicks the button,it's going to triggered an XSS.

Now,Here comes the tricky part regarding Unvalidated redirection-

Now if you inject ```javascript://%250Aalert(document.location="https://google.com",document.location="https://www.facebook.com")``` at the end of url like this 

https://www.semrush.com/redirect?url=javascript://%250Aalert(document.location="https://google.com",document.location="https://www.facebook.com")

and a particular user click go to site,first page will popup google.com and then it's going to redirect to facebook.com.

Please Consider it and let me know.

With Regards
Kunal

(Attaching with Single POC )
F263582

## Impact

An attacker can perform dangerous attacks using XSS.

activities.message:
Just copy and paste this link diretly to check
```1) www.semrush.com/redirect?url=javascript://%250Aalert(document.cookie)```
```2) www.semrush.com/redirect?url=javascript://%250Aalert(document.domain)```
```
3)https://www.semrush.com/redirect?url=javascript://%250Aalert(document.location=%22https://google.com%22,document.location=%22https://www.facebook.com%22)
```

don't use hackerone redirection page as it will again decode %250a to %0a .

Thanks
Kunal :)
Thanks for the report, we will investigate this.

Hello @sergin,
Thankyou for your response.

Kunal :)

Please copy and paste link directly for vulnerability.
Bug's pushed to appropriate team. We are waiting for team's response.
Oh great! thankyou for your response @sergin :).

Hello @sergin, out of these 3 payloads, this payload was different ```javascript://%250Aalert(document.location=%22https://google.com%22,document.location=%22https://www.facebook.com%22)```

as it was first giving an alert box of google.com, but laterwards it was redirecting to facebook.com, for me this was kind of interesting as I tried to inject two document.location in same payload, but turn out one was giving alert box and another one is redirecting.

Just a little info from my side.

Thanks
Kunal
Hello, any update?
We are still waiting for team's response.
Thanks for the information @sergin :)

Hello Security Team

This type of payload is also working like

```
javascript://www.semrush.com/%250aalert(document.domain) 
```
It means that in url link,it will display domain name but we can trigger XSS so that victim will not know the injected code.

Fix this type of payload also.

Thanks
Kunal

F265115
Hello @alla any update?
We'll inform you about any updates. Thank you for your patience.
Thanks for making our service safer!

Thank you semrush for the bounty, but it still need to be resolved completely as I can see XSS can be triggered.
Thanks
Kunal

Hello Semrush,this issue has been resolved, you can change to resolved state and then close, XSS is not working anymore.
Thanks
Kunal

Hello @sergin  and @alla ,can we close this report? 
It seems to be fixed now.

Thanks
Kunal
Yes, it fixed, sorry for the delay.
Thankyou @alla.
Hello @alla,it's been 3 months,can we disclose this if you don't mind.Just asking.
Yes, you can request disclose for this report.
Thanks and have a great day :).
